He was survived by his wife, Ali; five children, Steve March-Tormé, Melissa Torme-March and Tracy, Daisy and James Tormé; and two stepchildren, Carrie Tormé and Kurt.
He was survived by his wife, Ali; five children, Steve March-Tormé, Melissa Torme-March and Tracy, Daisy and James Tormé; and two stepchildren, Carrie Tormé and Kurt.
On August 8, 1996, a stroke ended Tormé's 65-year singing career.
In February 1999, he was awarded the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award.
He died from another stroke on June 5, 1999, at the age of 73.
